item.title: My shower, 23rd July
item.description:
Despite previous reports and attempts to address the problem, the water pressure remains extremely low and continues to cause significant inconvenience. This issue has persisted for an unacceptable length of time and is now affecting my daily hygiene.

item.description:

item.title: Object sticking out of rd - rectory lane/baugh rd sidcup, 23rd July
item.description:
I am writing to report a hazardous road condition that caused damage to my vehicle and to seek compensation for the resulting costs. On 20th July 2025 at around 9:45 PM, I was driving through a width restriction on Rectory Lane (DA14 5AE), near the junction of Baugh Road, when my tyre was sliced by a sharp, exposed object sticking out of the broken road surface. I have attached a photograph showing the current condition of the area. The road is severely damaged, with broken tarmac, debris, and raised edges posing a serious danger to road users. There were no visible warning signs in place to alert drivers to the hazard. The only marking present was a piece of red and white tape, which had fallen onto the ground and was therefore completely ineffective and invisible while driving, especially in low-light conditions. This lack of proper signage made it impossible to anticipate or safely avoid the obstruction. As a result, my tyre was punctured beyond repair, requiring immediate replacement. I believe this damage was directly caused by the unsafe and poorly marked condition of the road, which falls under the councilâ€™s responsibility to maintain. I also urge the council to take urgent action to properly signpost and repair this hazard before it causes further damage or injury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baugh Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wood bollards removed by vandals, 23rd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Flat Iron Square, The Borough, London
